Yes. Mathematically it makes more sense. If I am guaranteed a loss because our team has bronze, silver, and gold on the same team, then I have lost an average of 30 minutes of my time for nothing. At least with proper matchmaking I have a fair chance of winning so it's not automatic wasted time before the game even starts. 

You cannot have fair moba games based on measuring average total mmr of the whole team. It never works and only leads to toxicity. Because you dont know who is getting paired against who in lane. You're also not able to factor in how some roles are inherently more important than others in terms of ability to solo carry. So that gold assassin in mid lane up against a bronze enemy is going to autowin the entire game off snowball power alone, especially if the gold player on the enemy team is only playing support. 

Only matchmaking where every single player is the same mmr will result in fair games. 

This is exactly what faker was saying about challenger tier. Its no longer a real measure of skill when you're getting diamonds on teams.

I don't know too much about how it was in high MMR matches, but prior to season 6 in gold and silver MMR and even in most of my normal games, all of my matches were instant queues.  Now, i don't believe that matchmaking is the best that it can be, but I don't believe the solution that everyone is asking for is possible.

If we are comparing prior to season 6 and season 6 onward (disregarding season 8 because I believe the problems we are experiencing this season, in silver and gold MMR, have nothing to do with matchmaking but rather with game design and balance, but that's a discussion for another thread), matchmaking in silver and gold was leaps and bounds better after the introduction of role selection in season 6.  My opponents recieved the role they wanted and thus everyone was more evenly matched.  Every single one of my games were higher quality (disregarding balance) because everyone was playing what they were good at. 

Now I understand that this doesn't work the same way in diamond+ because of the significant numbers difference between the two cases, but I don't believe that extending queue times will help.  It's not that extending queue times won't increase the quality of the games, but by offering infinite time to find an evenly matched game, the games are most certainly going to be higher quality, but if you take into account that challenger games prior to role selection were already unbearably long, if you wanted evenly matched challenger games with role selection included, with no autofill because obviously with autofill said person won't be playing at their best and thus not the most even game, the queue times will be beyond unbearable not to mention the impact that might have on challenger streamers.

In the end, the question shouldn't be whether we want riot to make matchmaking better by increasing queue time, but whether we are willing to sacrifice role selection in order to have higher quality games.  

Of course, this is just a high MMR issue and these issues don't particularly plague the lower portion of the spectrum.

Riot fucked it up a long time ago and has only tried to bandaid it since then because their ego gets in the way of them admitting they suck at matchmaking.  Hell, they are so delusional they thought dynamic queue was the best thing since sliced bread.

Here's the problem:
RIOT could increase the queue times and you would probably still get matched with that 'troll' that you are complaining about.  The system doesn't need a lot of time to match players unless they are in Diamond.  You see the 'troll' doesn't mind waiting for games.  Trolls are willing to wait hours to get in a game with you (yes, you read that correctly, hours).  The system doesn't have magical 'troll detection'.  It doesn't filter out this player you are trying to avoid by letting you wait longer in queue for a match.  The system looks for someone to match this 'troll' with and it will match that 'troll' with you sometimes because it has to find a match for the 'troll'.


So increasing queue times will just make everyone spend more time not playing the game and the only players that don't mind spending needless amounts of time waiting are players that don't know any better and... trolls.
